intro: Diaphananthe vagans, commonly known as the wandering diaphananthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
